title: trouble with web speech after upgrade
content:
I run OctoPrint on a Raspberry Pi connected to a 3d printer that runs this speech plugin - https://github.com/jneilliii/OctoPrint-M117SpeechSynthesis

Previously, I was running Firefox under Ubuntu 18.04, but I had to upgrade to 22.04 for reasons. When I did Firefox updated itself as well, using a version (108) grabbed from the snap servers instead of the one from the repositories. When it did, this plugin was broken.

When I log into the OctoPi server through the Firefox browser, this plugin is supposed to show voices installed from which I can choose. That drop-down is empty now, though, so the plugin cannot speak.

Someone on reddit suggested I try using a .deb instead of the snap package. I couldn't find a .deb but I did try installing using the PPA as well as the direct download from mozilla.

Using the PPA instead of the snap, the web page for OctoPi hung without fully loading, with CPU usage for something called Isolated Web Co up to 50%!

Using the direct download and manual install method, that same process rose up to about 30 or 40% and the page took a minute before it finally fully loaded, but it did load and the plugin did find voices, so...

The issue does seem to be in the snap distributed version. I just can't deal with the load times and CPU usage of the other methods. But this does narrow it down, though...


Does anyone have any ideas on how I can fix this? I don't know what to look for and the plugin developer doesn't know, either.
creator: rebeltaz1

title: Comcast Mail Display problem
content: The Firefox display of Comcast mail has been quite good for many years. However, possibly after an update, the display of Comcast Mail has missing items, failure to update some, and just a very messed display that cannot be relied on. Tried the same mail account on Edge and it is perfect. Do I stay with Edge or can my Firefox account be fixed?
creator: boleyd

title: scripting and redirecting by web sites
content:
'Why isn't there a way to stop scripting/redirecting when you click on a link? For example you click on a link thinking you are going to download something, but you are redirected to an AD site, or a Game site. Someone is racking up "clicks" for cash.

I.E. had a way to stop scripting altogether, or to allow you to choose to be be "asked" if you want to be redirected to another page, when a site wants to be redirected years age. So it shouldn't be that hard for you guys to set it up too.

I'm sure you just didn't think of it, but it is becoming a common problem with many sites, where someone manages to hack in a redirect an make some money getting "clicks", and worse, tricking people into downloading bogus shit programs like chromius.
creator: whiz666
